questions.question: What is the conclusion? If Mary is allergic to dogs, then she is allergic to poodles.

choices.answer: Mary is allergic to poodles
Mary is allergic to dogs

questions.question: What is the hypothesis?If an animal lives on land, then it is not a fish.

choices.answer: the animal is not a fish
the animal lives on land

questions.question: What is the conclusion If Dalton breaks his arm, then he goes to the emergency room.

choices.answer: Dalton breaks his arm
Dalton goes to the emergency room.

questions.question: If Tony gets a raise, then he takes a vacation.  What is the converse?

choices.answer: If Tony does not get a raise, then he takes a vacation.
If Tony takes a vacation, then he got a raise.
If Tony doesn't get a raise, then he doesn't take a vacation
If Tony takes a vacation, then he didn't get a raise.

questions.question: If Henry is playing dodgeball, then it is recess. What is the contrapositive?

choices.answer: If Henry is at recess, then he isn't playing dodgeball.
If Henry isn't playing dodgeball, then he isnt at recess.
If Henry isn't at recess, then he isn't playing dodgeball.
If Henry is at recess, then he's playing dodgeball.

questions.question: If Ben doesn't graduate, then he doesn't pass his Micro class. Whats the INVERSE?

choices.answer: If Ben graduates, then he  passed his Micro class.
If Ben passes his Micro class, then he graduates.
If Ben doesn't graduate, then he didn't pass his Micro class
If Ben passes his Micro class, then he doesn't graduate.

questions.question: This type of reasoning uses faces, definitions, and properties to prove  a conjecture is true.

choices.answer: inductive
deductive
converse
contrapositive

questions.question: Is the following conditional true? If tomorrow is Tuesday, then yesterday was Monday.

choices.answer: yes
no

questions.question: If John runs downhill, it will rain. Based on this, which of the following must be true.

choices.answer: John runs downhill.
It rains.
If it rains, John runs downhill.
If it doesn't rain, John doesn't run downhill.

questions.question: Which statement is a counterexample to the statement, "No mammals live in the ocean"?

choices.answer: A snake is not a mammal.
A dog does not live in the ocean.
A whale is a mammal and lives in the ocean.
A robin neither lives in the ocean nor is a mammal.

questions.question: What type of reasoning using patterns to make a conjecture?

choices.answer: inductive
deductive

questions.question: Which is an appropriate counterexample to the statement, "All birds are robins"?

choices.answer: Some animals are birds.
A pigeon is not a robin.
All robins are birds.
A robin is a bird.
All dogs have 4 legs.  Benji is a dog.  Benji has 4 legs.
All dogs have 4 legs.  Astro has 4 legs.  Astro is a dog.
Every frog I have seen has been green.  All frogs are green.

questions.question: What is the process of using a rule to make a specific conclusion called?

choices.answer: deductive reasoning
hypothesis testing
inductive reasoning
intuitive reasoning
